r9DLAjcK7ERiyyzVIjZFHg.text: Oh wow! Boy was I surprised. Came here for dinner w/ a few co-workers. We sampled several bottles of wine, we tried the lobster, shrimp and oyster appetizers. All delicious and very fresh.  I ordered the scallops for dinner and they were probably one of the best scallops I've had in a long time. Just the right flakiness and the dressing complimented the seafood very Well. We ordered several sides... lobster mash potatoes and truffle Mac n cheese were my favorites. Service was on point and the dinning room was quite elegant inside. Great for dates and groups.

qGbBGS-fW7Wi2uJ_mlQTeg.text: Eddie V's was the best dining experience I've had. I had the pleasure of celebrating my birthday here and it was phenomenal. A birthday was mentioned in the reservation and they did a great job celebrating it. We had the best seat in the house. The table was decorated with confetti and i had a hand written birthday card.  We enjoyed 2 delicious glasses of wine.  For dinner i enjoyed the swordfish steak. It was topped with a great mix of crab meat & avocado. I ordered a side of their brussel sprouts. Delicious and buttery. Also included bacon pieces.  My husband ordered the 2 tier shellfish. It is intended for a shared option but he ordered it as his main meal. It had 2 lobster tails, oysters (east & west coast) , delicious jumbo shrimp and 4 different sauces and crab meat. It was served looking awesome (see picture)  My server bought my dessert. I ordered the well talked about bananas foster dessert. It had happy birthday written on it in chocolate. The waiter lit the 151 rum at the table  to caramelize the bananas perfectly. The dessert was beyond phenomenal... Literally the most melt in your mouth, amazing dessert.  They made me feel like a queen on my birthday. We had an amazing time. Server was beyond kind. He gave us his business card so that he can serve us another time.  Valet is $8 and well worth it.  Treat yourself. This was a great experience

xm4e6lGczN0xHDYN_pcCpQ.text: Good however OUTRAGEOUSLY expensive. Plan ahead before dining here unless money is no object. VAvpetOm4angKn23djS8gA.text: I confess that we are not (quite) Eddie's audience--the price was a reach for me and my husband, but we were celebrating a special occasion, and I decided champagne at $20 a glass was worth it this once. The space is beautiful, the staff were all super helpful, and the live music for a full house on a Tuesday evening was a nice touch. This is the place to go to celebrate an engagement, a promotion, or a nice fat tax refund. Try the champagne sauce with their oysters on the half shell. The swordfish had a beautiful presentation. The vegetable sides are large enough for 2-4 people, and even the side salads can be shared by 2 people. We were full after eating our meal but plan on coming back one night just to feel special and try dessert.

wSh-HshKODj_bZjRqp8h1g.text: Lets start off by saying, Wow!  I was nervous coming here because its owned by the group that owns Olive Garden, and Red Lobster. But this place with the service and environment blew me away.  The interior is so nice, its in a renovated space in the Union Trust building. They had nice jazz band playing.  For apps we have the Calamari, Lobster Tacos, and Crab cake. The lobster tacos were my favorite, you get two tacos filled with lobster. The Calamari was crispy and was a little spicy was so good. The Crab Cake (you only get one but enough to share) was all crab and barely cake, which is how you would want them. I also had the Lobster bisque, it was ok, I would go with the Crab and Corn chowder for sure next time.  Dinner, I had the Lobster and Filet. Filet was cooked perfectly and I had to get the blue cheese fondue for my steak. That was a really good decision. The lobster was cooked to perfection.  For the sides, we went with Brussels sprouts, Corn, Lobster Mash Potatoes, and Truffle Mac Cheese. The Mac and Cheese was not as good as we thought, but the other sides made up for it.  I would suggest the lobster mash potatoes, chucks of lobster and cheesy potatoes, what could go wrong.   I would differently recommend this place, good for a nice dinner.

i7pEik2fBIZgZ2FqOfwxmA.text: It's rare I do this, but I must. Eddie V's atmosphere is jovial and pleasant. Accommodating and cheerful. This was the feeling I got while eating there. But, the prices are ridiculous for the quality of food you are being served. Being the restaurant is downtown Pittsburgh I understand the rent must be high. Me and my buddy's got the shellfish tower. The shrimp were dry, no drawn butter for the lobster. The crab meat was dry as well. I then took a chance on the $89 South African lobster tails. They tasted no different than the Maine lobster tails. Just a tiny bit sweeter. But we're double the price. I asked for a salad and lobster bisque. I asked they arrive separately before the main course. They arrived at the same time and the serving waiting poured the soup before I could stop him. So I had both soup and salad sitting before me, which made me rush to eat the salad before the soup got cold. The desert of chocolate cake was Devine, but the vanilla bean ice cream was icy, not creamy (you know what I mean?). And finally I accidentally left my credit card at the restaurant after our meal. When I returned to pick it up the very next day,  the staff informed me that there was no credit card there. I must have made a mistake they said. I then asked, a couple of times and was finally given to the manager that was on duty. I asked to check with the waiter that had waited our table. They informed me he was not working that day. Now, I was only stopping by the restaurant to get my card. It was a very busy day for me. I didn't have a lot of time and was returning to Los Angeles the next morning and was going to really need my Amex. I then asked them to personally call him. They were not keen on that idea. I didn't really care about how  keen they were on my idea. I insisted. Finally they called him.  And guess what. The waiter had pocketed my amex card and taken it home with him. He had forgotten to give the card to his manager or lost and found or whatever they do with credit cards that are mistakenly left behind. Now, once all was clear they asked if I wanted any water, a drink, to sit at the bar, some dinner. I informed them that I had a very busy day and no time for that. They told me it would be an8-10 minute wait. 20 minutes later the waiter arrived and handed me my card. He too apologized. Now, I thought that they would give me discounts for dinner at another time. Or coupons or something besides having me eat dinner right then and there. They did not. But they did smile and apologize for my inconvenience. When you are a 5 star restaurant you take the hit for something that really went wrong for a customer. Now there are other Eddie V's around the country. I often travel to Detroit for business. I have friends in Dallas and find myself in Boston every 2 or 3 years for business, months at a time. What do you think people?  Am I a cry baby, or do you expect a little more from a supposedly top notched, high caliber restaurant?  I end with this, the food was mediocre at best. Our waiter overall was good, the Malbec was balanced and tasty. I just expected more I guess.

v9SeJz_-cJKj9w2hDr6hqw.text: Please don't order the Maverick. You only get half of a drink. Also, be sure to sit at bar, service is very slow at tables during happy hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. I waited 15 minutes for half of a drink?

aUArhVhw8Y2oB32MbyU9YQ.text: Had a fantastic experience here recently on Thanksgiving weekend 2017.  Only downside was we booked through Open Table and waited a solid 25 minutes past reservation time for our table.  Anyway, the wait was worth it because the meal and service were excellent.  Our server ended up bringing us complimentary champagne as well as desert for the special occasion we were celebrating and was frequently checking on us in between every other phase of the experience.  One of the specials this evening was a one pound (huge) South African lobster tail.  I wanted that, my wife wanted filet, both were more than either of us could eat, we each wanted surf & turf, so the server suggested we get one of each and he'd split them table side even though they're prepared as individual entrees.  That's what he did and the result was perfect; half a filet and a huge 1/2 pound of lobster, and of course lots left over for the next day.  The Patron perfect margarita was excellent; great taste, plenty of booze to meet the price point, so I was happy.

Ptz09qrqBT7vzI0nvroEtA.text: Outstanding all around. Delicious food (Lobster trio, sea bass, NY Strip and bananas foster cake...yummy). Well-crafted drinks. Amazing service. They had a Father's Day card on the table waiting for us. Mark is an exceptional waiter! Looking forward to going back and trying the sister properties. Thank you for a great dinner experience, Eddie V's Pittsburgh team!

89JNOR225MG2C-DEYms7Aw.text: My boyfriend and I came to Eddie V's for dinner prior to attending a show at Heinz Hall. First of all, the service was exceptional. Our waiter asked if we had any time constraints and said he'd make sure our check was on the table at a specified time when I said we were attending a show. He was attentive to us but not overly bothersome considering the restaurant was not busy while we were there. He also cracked a few jokes and was very personable.   The craft cocktails we ordered came quickly and were very good. We both ordered filet mignon and they were cooked perfectly medium rare. The au gratin potatoes were also delicious, as was the Godiva chocolate cake we had for dessert. There were some seafood items I would love to try on their menu, so I hope to come back in the future.   Eddie V's is certainly in the higher price range, but the service and food was beyond worth it.

dnpsTF0B-HkFrzHnL0ldFQ.text: Best night out in a very long time! From the beginning until the end. I truly felt like a bride on our 20th Wedding Anniversary.  Our table was set with roses and Champagne.  We were congratulated by several staff members on our special night.  Mathew our 5 star server was spot on with his description of  the menu items.  He guided us through our entire meal.  I can not say enough about his service skills.  Salads were fresh, Ribeye cooked to perfection which was accompanied by sea scallops.  My husband is still talking about the crab fried rice. Our divine dessert tray was off the hook! The live jazz was fabulous.

sSuGiao3R07V0CKgUnWnmw.text: I love Eddies ! However tonight was horrible service!  we ordered our food and we order appetizers salad and the main course they brought two of the three meals all together at one time except for break it out the side dishes about my food out left and my two children were halfway done eating their food things happen so I really didn't mind I had to get up and go to the bar and asked for steak knife I had it at another waiter to refill my drink I got my food with the others were about done eating their food and my drink was sitting at the bar so long....when I got it it was water down I did not even drink it. very very very   manager came over she did not clear any plates on the table she just put the food down and walked away.  Will I go back... yes .... maybe tonight was just a bad night. It happens but for $250 it really should be a near perfect night. But I will go back because they have one of the best bands on Monday night.

GhGYmWIW1-orS43lnj88Gw.text: No stars.  None. This place was awful and just a rip off. We suffered it because of our friends but will never do that again.   Details: 1. I was asked if I wanted to wait for my party or be taken to our table. I said I'd like to sit at our table. After I had waited my turn in line, they sat 3-4 tables who walked in after me while I just stood there...waiting for what?  2. After ordering, every drink order, appetizers, then main course, we were first brought someone else's. They got it wrong each time, then we had to wait a very long for our correct order. We were headed to the theater so... 3. Oysters were fabulous. Ok so I'll give a star for that. 4. My entree. Scallops. 5 over-done, over-salty, tiny scallops cost $37!!! Literally an appetizer size portion cost $37!!! And no sides, just 5 minuscule scallops. Did I say they were over salted? 5. My husband had a tiny steamed and over salted, soaking in soy sauce (not miso as the menu said) piece of sea bass.   The service sucked. The food was sub-par and far to expensive. I feel like a total sucker for not walking out the moment they sat all those people before me. What we do for friends.

ufr8Wm2e39ZVbKI69EcD_Q.text: SPECTACULAR!!!!!!  So incredibly elegant!!!!!  The food and service were amazing and the Alex Peck Trio was fabulous!!  Best dirty martinis in town and the seafood tower appetizer was worth every penny - it was more than enough for a meal for 2-3 people!!!  Valet parking makes downtown access easy and reasonably priced!!!  I Can't wait to go back!!!!

K1_Vn9yUnDpIzRrmNVxiAg.text: This is a FIVE star restaurant--anything posted to the contrary is just wrong (or the hater has no idea how to order a decent meal).  Excellent steaks, fresh high quality seafood and inspired combinations.  Bravo, Eddie V's!  I started with the Tartare of Pacific Tuna (curry and sesame oils, avocado, mango and citrus), followed by a second course of Crab and Corn Chowder (smoked bacon, potatoes and sweet corn).  In all honesty, if there were a power outage or other catastrophe that ceased all kitchen function at that point, I would have left completely satisfied with my meal.  The tuna was superb, and the citrus/mango perfectly complimented the ample-sized fish stack.  The Chowder was also noteworthy--a hearty, flavorful effort to be savored.  But my main course was simply spectacular.  I had the 22oz USDA Prime Bone-In Ribeye, paired with the Brussels sprouts, bacon and shallots.  The steak was melt-in-your-mouth tender and exquisitely flavored, and the sprouts were equally delicious.  I even sampled a bit of my dining companion's crab fried rice, which was a unique and welcome departure from the go-to baked potato.  I really don't think you could miss ordering off of the expansive Eddie V's menu.  The meal left me with just one disappointment--why are you not located in Utah?!?!  Thanks for a terrific meal, Eddie V's!

GG9-guEYuXPY9_YqgUW_Bg.text: This was my second trip to Eddie Vs. First was to the bar for dinner and split a delicious filet and got bowl of the crab and corn soup. A perfect meal! The medium cooked filet is yummy and full of flavor! Last night a group or friends and I headed to Eddie Vs for restaurant week! DIVINE!!! After getting it twice, the 8oz filet is the best that I've had I Pittsburgh! The service is fantastic as well! Treat yourself!

rQFkgsdWuew0MigBkKNICw.text: On Monday night, my boyfriend told me he made no-reason date night dinner reservations for Thursday a Eddie V's. (what a gem, right?)  I told him we didn't have to go somewhere so fancy, but he insisted and I am so glad he did!  We just got home from an all-around amazing dining experience.  We had reservations at 7 and were promptly seated.  We both started with a cocktail - mine was the pomegranate mule and he had the Gatsby sour.  Our awesome waiter brought both out along with some tasty, warm bread.  Ryan decided on the crabcake to start and it was the perfect size to share and hold us over. It was the best crabcake I have ever had - fresh, perfectly seasoned crab with hardly any filler and fresh lemon squeezed over it.  Really to die for.  I had the chilean sea bass and my boyfriend had the crusted sole.  We shared the crab fried rice accompaniment per a friend's recommendation and everything was so flavorful and just perfect.  The atmosphere is upscale and dimly lit - very romantic and fancy. I am so happy we stopped in for such a fantastic meal.  PS..hi ry

ykam9fShKcLK8MDwCRNqJw.text: We made a return visit to Eddie V's for Restaurant Week. Overall, the food was excellent. My daughter and I shared an order of the lobster tacos which had nice sized chunks of sweet lobster. I selected the crab and corn chowder which was the weakest item of the evening. Very little crab or corn flavor-bacon overpowered the flavor. My swordfish was juicy and flavorful and served with grilled tender asparagus. The bananas foster cake was flamed tableside and was a delightfully rich, buttery cake served with a scoop of butter pecan ice cream. Perfect ending to a great meal. The service was professional and attentive.

0Qr9OowWT89ZoSgsU7OGBQ.text: I took my wife here for her birthday and could not have been happier with the choice. I stated in the reservation that it was for her birthday and the restaurant went out of their way to make sure she felt special. The table was decorated with happy birthday greetings along with a nice card! They also gave us complimentary dessert and Prosecco for our celebration.   The ambiance of the restaurant is great with lovely music playing in the lounge. The waitstaff was very attentive and knowledgeable. We ordered tuna tartare to start and share. For our mains she had the Chilean sea bass and I had a bone in strip steak. Both were excellent. We also enjoyed an order of crab friend rice that was tasty.   They have an extensive wine collection and there is happy hour in the bar at certain times. I will definitely be back and recommend Eddie Vs!

_4CtoPlxJLN4koJj0Ap-rg.text: We were staying at the nearby doubletree and i wanted seafood. This place seemed a little pricey but we decided to go anyways. Our server was great! We sat in the lounge and they had live jazz music.   Started with the summer love oysters. They came with three sauces and the spicy horseradish was our favorite!   I got the sea bass and it was nothing short of delicious.   Bf got the 12oz filet and it was cooked perfectly. I also got the crab stuffed shrimp which was really good.   The atmosphere was great and so was the food!

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

qbdA3t0JCfOXONytSKXANg.text: Very nice place but we had our challenges.  Our waiter Thomas did an excellent job! He was well trained and very personable. As you read in, you'll realize the importance of that fact.   We got there st 5:30 on April 16, the Pens playoff game started at 7:30 and we had to be out of there by 7:00 sharp. The first thing Thomas did was review our time line to get us out of there on time.  Unfortunately, that didn't happen and we ended up being very rushed to eat our main course, and had to skip the most important part of every meal; desert!!!!!  Not his fault, he did what he could.   The appetizers were very good, calamari, lobster tacos, and shrimp cocktail.  All were very tasty and they were served pretty quickly.  So far, so good.   The second course was a Caesar Salad, generous portion, and the big chunks of grated cheeses were really exceptional.   My main course was an 8 ounce filet special with a crab cake, both were amazing, but the steak needed another couple minutes in the grill. While waiting for our main course, Thomas warned us that the kitchen was struggling to keep up. We all checked our watches, and we're getting concerned. (Remember that the only goal of the night that night for the Pens was less than a minute into the game). The Manager came over to grovel and assure us they were doing all they could.  The truffle Mac and cheese was heavenly, the au gratin potatoes were surprisingly huge and also very good. Unfortunately, we really had to chow down in a hurry to get out of there in time.   When I asked about desert, Thomas didn't even respond because the guy paying the bill wanted wanted to go! Best part, the Manager came back over and comped (fancy for free) all of our main course meals!  That's 4 x $50 on average. Pretty happy ending. I will come back and try the place again when time isn't an issue.

TBPaBO-SzYxbRuAZ3ZWjcQ.text: I'm downgrading Eddie V's based on last night's disappointing experience. We weren't seated for our 7:30 reservations until 7:50 and the gaggle of checkin chicks clearly didn't give a damn. They were polite, cute, and respectful, but they were obviously trained to respond with platitudes, not information. Bad start. Our dinners were fine but not notable. We split the caprese salad and had halibut and stuffed shrimp entrees. We also shared the au gratin potatoes. It was too late for desert. The dining room is attractive and the live jazz is enjoyable and very unusual. The prices require perfection which wasn't delivered last night. We will think hard about returning.

4RkwCmgdkPo5aNzxGUhEpw.text: If you go here and love interesting cocktails, you MUST order the Hope Diamond. It's a beautiful drink, tastes wonderful, and the presentation is amazing. I have never seen anything like it elsewhere. As someone who doesn't like seafood, this is a place I don't get too excited about visiting but this is often a top pick of our friends. Most seafood places will always have a token chicken dish on the menu and/or a steak option. I decided to order the gnocchi on this trip and wasn't really impressed but also wasn't surprised that it wasn't great. Everyone else loved their food and the waiter was fabulous. We were celebrating a birthday and the desert was beautiful. The lounge is a great place to spend an evening listening to the live music that they often have for entertainment. We will likely go back and I will order that steak next time.

4wScUdiZTudoNbVfqyXRpA.text: I picked Eddie's due to the live jazz. I sat at the bar and enjoyed happy hour with good quality wine.The Happ y hour menu included oysters Rockefeller, called Eddie's Rockefeller. Light, fresh and delicious. I the order the crabcake appetizer. It was fresh and full of delightful crabmeat encrusted with Panko crispy topping. Nice Atmosphere.

ztxviI_x1E3G7p0_kg1D-Q.text: Updating this as the Mangement team reached out and apologized for our issue. Really friend Mangement team that seems very committed to offering the best food and service.

gTNbbOaGhXEPclbr0GoMww.text: Absolutely amazing! This was my first time at Eddie V's after hearing many great reviews from friends and family. I decided to come here with a couple co workers and have dinner. We had the Seafood Large Tower that was beyond delicious! The three of us all had steak which was perfectly cooked. Desert was out of this world... just great. Unbelievably attentive and superb service. The restaurant has live music playing which made for an incredible atmosphere. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone who is looking to have an excellent meal with high-quality service.

npqdRhd4opRXd7sPTwneDg.text: Classic, elegant and beautiful restaurant/lounge.  We got a last minute reservation before to get there so we out table was in the lounge which it was nice except when it was crowded. Everybody was dressed elegantly but us, so I asked to the hatter if there was a dress code in there, he answered no. BUT I highly recommend you dress up if you're coming to this restaurant.  What I liked here:  There was lounge style live music Elegant decor and atmosphere  Option to wait in the bar for cocktails even we don't drink Great reception staff  Breads and salad came very quickly and they were delicious.  What didn't like that much: Too many people very close to our table because we were sat close to the bar. Chefs Classic NY Strip Steak was not that good for the price: it was too dry for me and the sauce was ookayy...   Ps.: For drinkers: this the perfect place for you, their wine list is excellent and diversified.

5MbuD1ys3p36qInySX1c4Q.text: Out of all of the high-end chain Steakhouse Eddie V's by far my favorite. This was our 4th maybe 5th time dining here and it was not a disappointment. We tend to go here for restaurant week starts their steaks alone are $45 apiece and with the restaurant week deal you get a steak and appetizer and a dessert for $35. Service is always impeccable, our server Olivia was courteous and attentive and there was never a time when I was wondering where she was because I needed something. we enjoyed a lovely crab and corn chowder for an appetizer. My husband upgraded his entree to this Chilean sea bass with miso broth it was incredible. I had the 8 ounce filet cooked medium rare with a dollop of truffle mashed potatoes, the steak was cooked perfectly and the truffle mash potatoes were a perfect mini accompaniment. We ordered the crab Fried rice as our side dish and it was beyond amazing I could eat that as a meal every day of my life and be happy. For dessert my husband had a mango sorbet with a chocolate cookie and I had a decaf coffee and the bananas Foster flambe butter cake. All in all a great evening at Eddie V's and we will be back.

PB6kC-RgVfmNF30-SR9-5Q.text: Absolutely loved everything about our visit to Eddie V's. Service was fantastic and the food was spectacular. You can tell they care about the quality of their service and the dishes. Atmosphere is on the fancier side which was perfect before we saw a snow at the Benedum. If you love Jazz music I recommend coming when the bands start and sitting in or very close to the bar. I also recommend reservations as I'm not sure what you'll get just walking in.   Food served ala carte. Two appetizers and two sides in addition to our entrees served our party of four perfectly. My swordfish topped with cilantro, avocado and grapefruit was just amazing!   Worth every dollar we spent and I can't wait to come back! Only wish I'd saved room for dessert!

WfkyUUQTaTK4wvqdY7Xv3Q.text: Excellent! Went for mom's birthday and was not disappointed. We ordered scallops, sea bass, red snapper, salmon, crab cakes, stuffed shrimp, au gratin potatoes, brussel sprouts, asparagus, crab fried rice, spinach, along with salads and everything was delicious. Our waiter was on point and very attentive. Wonderful experience!

W9bPm1TlMZE3K4S5rVJCKw.text: I know Eddie V's is a chain - but this place is a must-go. The food is superb, consistent and the service is great. They always have live music by the bar which makes for a lively atmosphere in a restaurant with great food (hard to find). They have a mix of steak and seafood so something for everyone.  On this visit we started with the calamari, ahi sashimi and burrata salad. The ahi was tasty but a little small, the calamari was good and enormous. The burrata was very small and not good for sharing but was definitely plenty with the other appetizers.  Dinner was followed with the Chilean sea bass - this was delicious, tender and cooked to perfection. We had the truffle Mac and cheese as an app along with the corn and asparagus. Get the truffle Mac - you won't regret this.  Finally for dessert we tried the creme brulee, butter cake and hot molten chocolate cake. The banana foster butter cake was out of this world. STOP right now and order the butter cake, don't question it! Thank me later. Wow!  Brayden gave us fantastic and professional service. We will be back. Thank you!

AtwMU7SqH0EqZ92-aAr3Jw.text: We do most of the steak restaurants during restaurant week. We eat out a lot and the steak restaurants each have their plusses and minuses so we judge on service as we are slow eaters and like to request when we like food and we like to enjoy our wine with dinner. Jocelyn is a  excellent server. Served us perfectly. Beautiful restaurant. Bartenders are also excellent very personable . Nice restaurant. Highly recommended.

Cs2833XunmPpwwfhcIFZ9A.text: In town for a wedding and we selected Eddie V's for dinner based on such Rave Yelp reviews and we are Pearl Jam fans (no connection, I know). The bar was comfortable, and a jazz quartet was playing close by. The bartender made Manhattans with Angel's Envy bourbon...delicious...   So we ordered almost everything... Kung Pao Calamari (zesty flavors and lots of crunch), Warm Goatcheese Salad (one of kind experience of flavors), Seabass in a light soy broth (Heavenly) and Parmesan Baked Sole (paled in comparison to the Seabass but it was a nice dish). Lobster and cheese mashpotatos were a bit over tbe top for us but its not like it isnt IIas advertised. No room for dessert so we split a Bananas Foster and practically licked our plates. The location is the first floor of an old building so makes sure you walk in and take a look aroubd the spectacular lobby.  The service might seem slow if you're in a hurry, but it felt to us like the pace was at ease on purpose, as a delicious meal should never be rushed. Why 4 stars? I would give 4.5 if possible, but it was not habds down perfect which is a 5 star review.

BmCCsBH8hBoPNPbRPqfnhw.text: Best steak house in town  If you like shrimp cocktail  Get the seafood tower   Went for are anniversary day decorated are table with rose petals and a card ask for Jeremy

WuzPrFF5qstGIfPLtzlwjg.text: Excellent high-quality food. Excellent music. Excellent service. My first time here and will be coming back

Y0RtxGfj6SVzx5W8svUNpw.text: Five star restaurant with five star quality! Eddie's V's is hands down the best restaurant for seafood in Pittsburgh. I've been to all that you can name and nothing comes close. They don't call it prime seafood for no reason, because that's exactly what it is.  My date was celebrating her birthday on a busy Friday evening and the experience was everything that we could've asked for and then some. She was greeted with a happy birthday note and even got her choice of a complimentary dessert. Fun and festive decorations were placed on our table which I should mention was the best seat on the house in our opinion.  For the second time I ordered the Norwegian salmon which is prepared crispy on the outside and moist on the inside. The best part of it all has to be the bananas foster which they flambe tableside. Perfection!

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

nMKSvhhcOcsWo1hCYSWFMw.text: My last 2 visits to an Eddie V's have not been great.  Starting to notice that the seafood versions vs the steakhouse versions are different. The steakhouse versions are way better.   We ordered oysters, steaks, bottles of vino, desserts and port.  Let's start by saying service was molasses in. January. Took 20 some Mins to get our first bottle of wine and took almost 40 to get our oysters. We arrive at 7:30 and didn't finish until 11pm.....  Oysters - Blue point. Good ones. Had to ask for cocktail forks, crackers and hot sauce. Should've been there already  Steaks - we wanted bone in filets and ordered, only to have server come back and say they don't have them. Most of us ordered 12oz filets and 2 in our party ordered fish and small filet. They messed up the delivery and gave wrong steaks to wrong people. One of them was rare vs medium rare which I was happy to snag from one of the crew but they should nail the cook temp here.   When we first ordered our meal I ordered a Pinot for our starter and then asked for a duckhorn merlot with our meal. The food showed up and then the wine followed after.....  The au gratin potatoes weren't cooked enough, the mac n cheese was way too chewy and the winner was the Brussels.   We tried a chocolate cake and had a couple of kiddie sundaes which were best of the night and a round of 10 year tawny's. Dessert was best course.   Overall for the money and expectation - definitely didn't meet the value prop I'm used to from Eddie V's. The Austin and San Antonio locations still rank tops and can't wait to go back to one of those to reset my Eddie clock

jyl5WorF8Cy-N-kxkjqGtg.text: I've been to one other Eddie V's location, in San Diego. This one is basically a carbon copy. The lobster bisque is to-die-for. I also had the Caesar salad, which was 4 stars. The bread and butter they bring to the table is VERY tasty.  I wish I could rate them higher, but 4 stars is a pretty good score from me.

xLbuWjopXIWmyEvwVunKGg.text: Service was great.  However, Lobster Bisque was tasteless and crab fried rice was extremely salty.   The Seabass and Snapper were both very good.

6ER74FOOrmkz2i8aYCz4Bw.text: The best steak and seafood in town. Jazz every night in a bustling great bar, but 3 quieter dining rooms that cut the chatter and still let your hear the music.

R27-d0FvQWr9LekjGbhkCQ.text: Great food, great service, and perhaps best supper club I've been too and I'm from NYC! Feels like 1958.....

VnaP7oOHKqISoARpXeVnQw.text: A great atmosphere, you don't feel like your in Pittsburgh. A classy and beautifully designed restaurant. The problem I had is we were rushed through dinner. We ordered oysters and the salad came before we were done with the oysters. Then the entree came as we finished our salad. For the money  I thought they could have spaced the meal out better. The salad was just ok. The bread was great. The wine selection is good for the money. The halibut was terrific.  The music trio was solid and a nice touch. I will go back and I recommend this place highly!

xIeKjkbD8fYFa6wRdMo-6Q.text: The perfect restaurant for a special occasion. My fiance and I celebrated our anniversary by having dinner at Eddie V's. Our server Alex was genuine and attentive. We had the lobster bisque which was tasty, but as other reviews have noted was a bit light on lobster. The Point Judith Calamari was excellent. The roasted cashews were unexpected, but delicious! For the entree he ordered the Chilean Sea Bass and I ordered the George's Bank Scallops. Both entrees were delicious and we thoroughly enjoyed our meals, as well as the shared side dishes--the Crab Fried Rice and the Butter Poached Lobster Mashed Potatoes. For dessert we shared the Hot Chocolate Godiva Cake which was served with vanilla ice cream. I'm not a huge fan of chocolate cake, but it just just the right amount of richness. Our server brought us complimentary glasses of champagne as well! We're fans and will be back in the future for more special occasions!

uKrlhTR5CHiSrbyDLcz-UA.text: I ordered a steak with no side orders.  Food was good.  But the presentation was awful: a big white plate with a piece of meat in the middle.  It was almost as if they were punishing me for not having ordered anything else.  Ridiculous are ridiculous.

23QnKNvhYTflEX_mT5ZsbQ.text: Food was outstanding but service not so much. 1 bottle of wine for 2 people entire 3 hours we were there. Yes, dinner was almost 3 hours as very busy and service was slow. 4 stars due to the food being absolutely amazing.

MZXAH3ot5n55Px6h-RuPpQ.text: Congratulations on you opening!  The restaurant looks amazing and my family had a great time catching up with great food, drink and music from Mark Goodwin.  Thank you and good luck!

wMekHiKRPUUCc1o-oFkQUQ.text: Amazing food and awesome service. Manager made us feel like we had been going there for years. Loved the ambience- great addition to our beautiful city!

TVFoXHGLVOQ9Ph7kY5lhZQ.text: Good atmosphere, menu, and wine list. Staff is friendly and helpful. Prompt service with a good cadence. Steak was above average. The seafood seemed to be more their suit.

e-Yf5k4LPrm4p9QW0Iagiw.text: Atmosphere is gorgeous but loud. It was impossible to hear others at my table by 715.  The food was ok, nothing was outstanding. Most dishes lacked a lot of flavor. The lobster tartar tasted spoiled.  Service was ok, it got worse towards the end of the meal.  I would come back for the cool atmosphere but the meal was certainly not worth the price.  I've had far better fish dishes at restaurants that weren't considered "fish" restaurants. The wine list was solid, but again nothing outstanding. A bit disappointing. Maybe I'll come back for a drink or appetizer but don't plan on rushing back anytime soon.

-MdaLtTGWryNDkKzJG6Auw.text: The service throughout the night was inconsistent.  I asked how the shrimp was prepared.  The server said, "medium, we prepare all of our fish medium." Uncooked shrimp? No thanks.  We ordered two appetizers, a salad, steaks, and a side dish.  The oysters were placed on the table without explanation of the accompanying sauces.  The salad was good, tomatoes were fresh.  The lobster mashed potatoes had so much butter that it was pooling around the edges of the bowl.  One steak was overcooked, came out medium well instead of medium rare.  The server took it back and the manager quickly came over to apologize and offered to even cook both steaks again so we could eat together.  We felt it was handled appropriately and would easily have returned for future meals after this.  However, the steak never came out.  I asked the server after a long while to see if it may be ready.  She came back from the kitchen frazzled and said, "it will be out but I don't have a time to give you."  Then a kitchen manager brought a piece of meat, set it down, did not wait for me to cut it open and quickly left. It was very fatty and appeared to be NOT the cut of meat (filet) that I had ordered.  It was over cooked, again.  The server happened to walk over and said, "yes, I thought that it didn't look right."  I left without eating dinner.  She brought the check over and said, "I'm sure you guys don't want dessert, so I brought the check."  The manager never followed up to see if I had received the new steak.  The issues could've easily been solved had someone not dropped the ball and given up on following through.  They did credit the check for two steaks, but really that was not the issue.  Unfortunately, this restaurant was a big let down.

Be07R-S70-buCS0qK7yIfQ.text: Always love coming here.  Last weekend was just an ok experience.  I made reservations for a birthday, they sat us at the wrong table.  The table next to us was decorated for her birthday, they didn't do anything about it.  And what happened to the dessert for birthdays?  Anyway, our server was nice but stretched way too thin, he obviously had way too many tables and was running around like an idiot.  Not the best experience but the food was good.

BtzRrYDU61RmhozcJvZIrw.text: I visited this restaurant before their official opening and was pleasantly surprised at how excellent the experience turned out to be.  The ambience was formal but very relaxing, and service was friendly and attentive.  Also, the live music was a very nice touch.    The food, while a bit on the expensive side, was fantastic and offered a great deal of variety.  I had the jumbo shrimp stuffed with crab meat, which was very flavorful and well prepared.  In addition ,the bartender was incredibly experienced and the drinks list was extensive.  The only complaint I have was for the dessert, which was a bit too heavy and needed to lighter to finish off the meal.    Overall, I would definitely recommend this restaurant and will go again when I visit Pittsburgh.

ki0khFDDypk_Xk-Z_CXiwQ.text: Been there twice Waited over 30 mins each time with resv Ran out of 8 oz filets Jan 17 Fab service  Fab food

HdmMgfTjYjA4BqA5mcjegg.text: The steaks are delish, of course. But I usually come here for the Hope Diamond cocktail which is out of this world and made from Pea Flower Tea and the Bananas Foster dessert that they serve literally on fire at the table. The live jazz makes this place stand out from the rest.

CrN7lOMz0tG_9rNugH9FHA.text: Best steakhouse in town. well managed establishment. Everyones steak came out perfect! side dishes were perfect for sharing -  kudos

Ejibh1LZZnIjplHRYR1g5g.text: The service was great, but the food was only ok! Too expensive for what you received. The bread was worth the calories!   Swordfish had been frozen and portion was tiny.

ImwCAkT9vwndmQzs1keLYw.text: Well we went for restaurant week and in my opinion treated just as such. Seated 30+mins late with a reservation, once seated it took so long to get a glass of water I was tempted to get a pitcher and pour it myself. Was looking forward to the filet medallions or 8 oz filet but both were sold out along with the 12oz filet. We ordered a dozen oysters and one option on the menu was sold out but the alternative was delicious. My husband ordered the Crispy Salt and Pepper Shrimp which were good but the sauce tasted very asian generic and kinda ruined the delicious scrimp. For our main course we had the Parmesan Sole and the Jumbo Gulf Shrimp both were very tasty. I ordered the shrimp since all of the filets were not and option and most of the seafood had a sweet or asian influence. For dessert once again they were out of what we were looking forward to, "Bananas Foster" Butter Cake with butter pecan ice cream but the waiter did say we could choose any dessert in its place which was very nice. My husband ordered the Hot Apple Cobbler which was more like a pie with burn crust and I got the Hot Chocolate Godiva Cake that to me was nothing special. We also had a glass of port with dinner that arrived in a very sticky glass. The desserts took a long time to come out and our waiter did comp the port as an apology for how long the desserts took, which was very nice of him. When we got our coats from the coat check the girl asked us how everything was an I was honest and said we were a bit disappointed as two things we came for were not available. A gentleman who works here gave my husband a card for a complimentary Bananas Foster Butter Cake which was a really nice gesture. All in all I think we should have not come during Restaurant Week because they were too overwhelmed and it ruined our first and probably last visit here. I appropriated the comps they gave us but at the end of the day if I am spending $200+ on a dinner I want to be happy when I leave. I understand the majority of the tables may have been spending more than us but I work hard and when we treat ourselves I want it to be a good experience and feel worth it rather than let down.  The food & service are good but during a busy time you may be underwhelmed.

U15oqgrvkZd4D1dnDW9zmw.text: I really enjoyed everything about this establishment. Professional, clean, nice decor, delicious food, great temperature, nice presentation and no long wait. I will definitely be back and recommend this place highly.

YU7LlD4hjG9UM4WPxw_W_g.text: Superb food and service. Wonderful ambiance, with a perfect mix of fun bar with live music, nice dinner room. Canno find one fault. Would return in a heartbeat

oWcQCQCaXuw1tmEHjFJceA.text: The restaurant went above and beyond for our special occasion. My boyfriend only gets Monday's off and it's tough finding a nice place that is open on a Monday. We had an amazing dinner. They gave us an intimate table and the service was amazing. I can't stop thinking about the goat cheese arugula salad!!!! If you aren't a steak eater, that is not a problem. The seafood is spectacular. I had the Maine lobster taco! And you cannot forget the truffle Mac and cheese. Save room for dessert!

i9lH7hZaa1yoIU-61lvl_A.text: Lovely atmosphere, excellent food, attentive staff.  It doesn't get better than Eddie v's.  Almost want to discount their success because of the "chain" thing but it impossible not to appreciate what this restaurant has to offer.  Hong Kong, miso and chili seasoned sea food was amazing!  Bollinger special cuvee is well priced on the extensive wine list and the cocktails looked fun too.  Reserve a seat in the dining room where you can still hear and enjoy the live jazz from the bar.  Look to spend $125 to $200 per person if you are drinking.

XRNqPv-EqsMx8KiLUiBj8Q.text: We had a fabulous group date night experience here last night. High class food (Calamari, George Banks Scallops, and the Banana Foster dessert were among the favorites of the night). Kudos to the wait staff for their knowledge of the menu and their attentive service. We so enjoyed the outstanding live jazz music and atmosphere, as well as the personal introduction to Chef Flavio.  We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Appetizer heaven! Lobster tacos, shrimp cocktail, calamari, and fresh yellowtail. Why choose? Just get them all!

MXYpPecDk2sXjHmnJHe5JA.text: Had a couple of days in Pittsburgh and past by this place.  It is a real class act.  Great staff in a wonderful setting and fantastic food.  We really enjoyed our night of decadence.

SuFN-lY0scSp_43E6xh_2Q.text: We met up with some family in Pittsburgh for the night and they chose Eddie V's for us and I'm glad they did. My wife and I love steakhouses in particular steak houses in Las Vegas.  I have to say without a doubt the steak at Eddie V's was one of the best I've had outside of Las Vegas. We also happened to be in Pittsburgh for restaurant week. We started the night with happy hour drinks before dinner. They had a fun drink/app menu at the bar. They had a special menu for this week that included a starter, main and a dessert for $35.99 which is a steal at any steakhouse. My wife and i both started with a salad that was okay but if we had to do it again i think we would both get the chowder or lobster bisque. For our mains I chose to upgrade my steak to a 22 oz bone in porterhouse with a side of asparagus. My wife chose the 8 oz filet and and asparagus as well. Her steak was also perfect. For dessert we decided to get two different things and split them. I had the berry sorbet and my wife the pannacotta. They were both very good and we were both couldn't eat another bite. I should also mention we had 3 bottles of wine between 5 of us (one family member was pregnant). The wine was provided by one family member who provided the wine. They charge a corkage fee which was was minimal for the quality of wine. Their wine list was very extensive.

aEBzkGWV2PCAbJIpPzyThg.text: Wonderful restaurant. Beautiful decor, nicely spaced tables, multiple rooms and a teriffic seperate Bar room. Fresh seafood, well  prepared dishes with effecient and friendly service. Live music in the bar every evening. Ecpensive but teriffic!!!!

RGLbfaR4W0vmeaUmuIi0sQ.text: High expectations as have been to Eddie V in Florida but failed to deliver on service, food and especially atmosphere.  May have been seated at the worst table in the restaurant in the bar area.  People leaning on dining table waiting for reservations, very loud.  Service was really spotty not filling water glasses clearing plates, etc.  Steak was dry and over cooked.  Waitstaff hit into back of chair at least 20 times.  Won't be back.  It's a shame wanted to love this place!  Management needs to do a much better job with crowd control.

gP0_M2evP492EBASC2GeUQ.text: One of our go to places and favorites! The live jazz is fantastic and six nights a week. Add in some discounted wines and bites were sold on a Monday night. Tony was promoted to manager and he's always made sure everything was perfect. This past Valentine's Day they made our night very special on every level. My fiance and I are out constantly downtown and travel so we do have high expectations of venues like this and steakhouses in general and this place has become our go to. I had the butterfish, the Alaskan long crab and sea bass the last few times and always have some of his steak. Every side is great and generous portions and their oysters are amazing. Perfect for a date or post work drinks and apps!

7qcIQChhDc1p5-VLjlIhxw.text: Wow, where do I even start. I brought my mom here for mothers day brunch and it was amazing. The staff was all so friendly and went above and beyond to make the brunch special. The food was to die for. A cinnamon roll (heaven), apps of deviled eggs topped with salmon, truffle, and crab, fried green tomatoes, main course of lobster omelette and steak and egg with scallop potatoes. Sadly our desserts that we got to go melted in the car, but I probably didn't need more to eat anyway lol. I can't wait to come back!

Yuxf7nhGNs7lhWWv3zYtEA.text: Went here for my birthday and wow this place was amazing. I loved the live music and atmosphere here. Our waiter Adam was great and made the experience. He helped walk us through the menu. We had the Hawaiian sashimi and the ahi tuna tartare to start. Both were rich in flavor and would definitely recommend. He also brought us oysters cause he heard my fiance saying she liked them and I had never really had them. The oysters (which I thought I'd hate) turned out being something I wanna come back here for and have more of. Then for dinner my fiance had the ahi tuna which literally melted in your mouth and I had the NY strip with the peppercorn sauce.  Definitely one of the best steaks I've had in pittsburgh. Finally we finished it off with some port and a creme brulee. Definitely will be coming back and telling others.

xr2x30Q_qJ-hVm9nP2iFzw.text: I was in on Thursday evening and was greeted by a gentleman at the front, who immediately asked if we had a reservation.  I find it helpful on a weekend to make reservations however on a Thursday evening and what appeared plenty of dinning tables available.  I feel like the reaction should be met with, "not a problem, we are so glad to have you join us," but in reality when I said no, I'm sorry I did not make reservations that he seemed annoyed and almost disgusted instead of being accommodating. That said, although I wanted to walk out I did not want my friend to not have a great night.  I immediately said, we would go to the bar.  It was great despite the initial lack of welcome.  They had a great jazz style band playing and we had a very nice table that initially was off to a slow start with our service but once I asked the bar tender if there was a possibility of being waited on, all was good.  The food, Calamari, Jumbo Shrimp, Lobster mashed, Fried Rice, Kettle Martinis, were all excellent.  Keep in mind, the food and atmosphere are high end in feel and when considering most high end markets like, NYC, LA, SF, one expects to pay a premium and all items are a la carte.  If your looking a cheap night out this would not be it but if your looking for a higher end experience this would hit the mark as dinner was around the 220.00 for two and well worth the money IMHO.  I'd say the staff needs to also realize most that walk in the door can easily afford it or rest assured they'd go elsewhere. To that end, one never knows what someone can and cannot afford so treat all guests as you'd want to be treated.

eoXlK2VM-FEOn4WiWdvoJg.text: Eric the bartender doesn't really belong here. Except he does. Corporate feel to the place but this guy is top notch. Great vibe, made me feel welcome and comfy never creepy. Helps this place go from chain to off-the-chain. Xoxoxo

oN29lq56YzLY3Uzm8pUriQ.text: Very much enjoyed our first meal here. From the seafood tower to the lobster bisque. The filet was perfect as were the jumbo shrimp. A birthday dinner for the love of my life with our 2 adult kids made for a great experience. Larry, our server, was a pleasure to deal with and went out of his way to provide complementary champagne as a celebratory pre-meal drink. The Mavericks were excellent both in flavor and in presentation. Be prepared as this restaurant is not inexpensive. Certainly not for an everyday meal. Our celebration was, however, worth it.  Just a tip that valet does not begin prior to 6 pm. Something the restaurant did not tell me when reserving for 545, so I had to park myself and drop my party at the front door. A little odd.

ksu-cr1qx4EMS4n9Wx_2zw.text: My experience is was amazing. Mike was my server and he made sure all my need were taken care of. He refilled/replaced drinks prior to being asked. Amanda (manager) also came to the table and introduced herself. My oyster were overcooked and both Amanda and Mike apologized for the inconvenience and replaced them promptly. Mike also accommodated us by taking an accompaniment off of the bill due to my oyster not being up to my liking. I will definitely be back. Ask for Mime!

uUeD7FDemflrwXsWA547jQ.text: Excellent meal!  I almost skipped all the temping dinner options and just kept eating their out of this world oysters.  Great ambiance for date night or adult night out.  Band played good music all night but wasn't too loud where you couldn't hold a conversation.

jg1at6-HGYukkKi85hWqUg.text: Yelpers made me pick Eddies!  The top reviews are right on.   Service immaculate very well thought out attentive and professional.  I'm quite picky about fish (fishermen grew up in Florida) Eddies not only did not disappoint but was extraordinary.  How do they get fish this fresh in landlubber Pittsburgh?  Chilean Seabass was a top quality cut perfectly prepared Asian style. The cold seafood tower was generous and showcased a diverse spread of lobster crab oysters on the half shell and large shrimp all fresh. Clients really enjoyed it. One ordered dessert the raspberry tort was wonderful. Great location and don't miss the live jazz in the bar!

EPEM6hteQP-vJ8JVmsneEA.text: My husband and I went to Eddie V's to celebrate our anniversary. We brought our infant with us and the staff was very accommodating.   When we were seated there were rose petals and a card from the staff wishing us a happy anniversary. Our waiter was Ron and he was exceptional!  He kept checking to make sure that we had everything we needed and was very personable.  He asked if we had any time restraints when we sat down which we did not.  We had the Ribeye, New York Strip, Brussels Sprouts, and Au Gratin Potatoes for dinner. We also had the Hot Chocolate Godiva Cake for dessert.  The food was amazing.  I would highly recommend to ask to sit in Ron's section when you visit.  He will make it the best dining experience.  Thank you Eddie V's for helping us have an amazing anniversary dinner!!

C_oOGrQz4W767VCydhMxew.text: Such a great meal with awesome service. Our waitress was super great, and put our dessert on the house. Along with the chef coming out personally and giving us another meal on the house even though the original plate was excellent. The drinks and food were all amazing. Would recommend to anyone.

4-JHtsebz7sEc28cH6ylLQ.text: Me and my gf came here for dinner. We ordered   1. House salad 2. Rib eye med 3. Grill Lobster  4. Lobster mash potatoes  5. 2 cocktails   Price: $150  Service: excellent   Food quality: steak was good and cooked to perfection. However lobster was terrible. It was frozen lobster, not fresh. I could've go to a chinese seafood restaurant and get better lobster quality for half the price. They put seafood in the name and for the price I expected fresh and not frozen.  Therefore 3 stars for the good steak, do not get the lobster.

KCo0Eh4OoloDFU0-TYUr-w.text: We had a fantastic experience. Three of us dined and everyone was delighted with their meal. From the well mixed beverages straight through to the Banana's Foster for dessert, each course delivered on flavor and presentation. A relaxing jazz band played in the bar and could be enjoyed from the main dining room. Servers were knowledgeable and friendly. Our waiter made excellent recommendations. We enjoyed three seafood meals and the battered oyster appetizer along with the Fuji Apple Salad. Next time we will add some sides to the main course.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bananas Foster carmalized tableside

ezwU0kh2Y8Kp6uvCo3yGEg.text: Since my previous reviews, I must take off a few stars. My first visit several months ago for my birthday was excellent, but during my last two visits, the employees have made many mistakes. Last time, my crab cake contained shell, my lobster bisque contained no lobster, and my salad contained no walnuts. This time, the staff knocked my expensive fur coat on the floor and I had to pick it up, and my filet mignon that was supposed to be medium was rare. A manager apologized to another person at my table, but he did not even look at me! I just ate the exterior of the red steak rather than wait for a new one. A few of the side vegetables were complimentary, probably because of my friend's messed-up order and the fact that vegetables cost less than the filet mignon.

i5YLch1u3UObc2uq-tjNtw.text: The most enjoyable part of our dinner was Kristina who was absolutely marvelous and accommodating and funny and caring and basically one of the nicest human beings we have Had the pleasure of encountering. Kristina was extremely professional and sincere. The seafood tower was exquisite and everyone at the table enjoyed it. We had swordfish and halibut and the food was exquisite. If you have time to go to Eddie V's I think you should ask for Kristina and enjoy the evening!

EAv8BGrtcSIT-mO0JtqzMA.text: The venue is nice, romantic, dim-lit ambiance. Exceptional service as expected. The dinner options are pricey and the portions are small, but the food was very good. There is also live jazz at plays in the evening. A cool spot for a couple to check out for a romantic date.

9xXlJ6vqH_VMX00yf3buoQ.text: This place is a gem! Staff was great and the waitress's recommendation on the tempura tuna was a home run. The drink selection and wine selection was exceptional. Top restaurant downtown in my opinion,can't wait to go back.

OWxn3RO4RORaSBemNYZQKQ.text: Our family was visiting town and wanted to enjoy a nice steak or seafood dinner. We were a little concerned by the business casual attire but found many people in jeans and a polo shirt. Great ambiance with live music and a attractive wine area. Seating was very comfortable. The AC was on a little high for Memorial Day weekend but we were able to adjust after awhile.   Our wait staff was great. Shared his favorites and gave us time to order when asked, kept the table clean and arranged for payment in a different area (we always fight for the bill at any restaurant).   All the steaks ( NY strip, filet mignon and bone in sirloin) were perfectly cooked. The sea bass was outstanding. The appetizers of the calamari and blue point oysters were enjoyable as well. The Godiva chocolate and bananas foster was a perfect end to the evening.   Very family oriented and private (they kept some predator hockey players in a special area). We would definitely recommend this place and go again.

eDnn6c_aoFog-6r4MaZrKg.text: Could not have a better experience!!! We went here for my boyfriends birthday and it was phenomenal experience from beginning to the end. We started the evening at the bar where I had the hope diamond martini. The ice cube melted in front of you that made the martini a beautiful purple color. It was delicious. We also had some apps of raw oysters, eddies Rockefeller, and filet sliders. All to die for! The bartender was very knowledgeable on the oysters and we had a great time with him. When we decided to sit down for dinner we got to the table and it was decorated for my boyfriends birthday with confetti on the table and their was a personalized card from the Eddie V's team. It was a nice personal touch. I had the lobster bisque to start which was an amazing tableside presentation...the bowl came out with a chock full of lobster meat in the bowl and the sever came over and poured the bisque from a hot tea kettle right in front of me!  Awesome presentation with an ever better taste! For dinner my boyfriend had the ahi tuna and I had the Parmesan sole. His tuna was a perfect rare color and flavorful with the surrounding vegetables and sauce with it. My Parmesan sole was so tasty! A nice light fish with a perfect Parmesan crust on it! The sauce was a lemon butter that was so flavorful accompanied by a tomatoes salad! Very yummy  and a perfect portion. We also got Brussels sprouts  and lobster mashed potatoes. The Brussels sprouts were tossed in a nice sauce and bacon (you can never go wrong with bacon!) the lobster mashed were so good as well! Loaded with lobster meat and so hot. Melted right in your mouth. For dessert, the sever brought over the bananas foster butter cake. They came over and flambeed it tableside and it was written happy birthday in chocolate sauce on the plate. (As seen in the picture) It was complimentary and very much appreciated for their  thoughtfulness. We also got the butterscotch panna cotta which was tasty as well! We will never forget this amazing experience. Our bartender was fun to our professional and knowledgeable waiter as well. They made us feel welcome, and was such a nice treat that we will never forget. We were visiting friends in Pittsburgh and made sure we went here and so glad we did. We live in reading, pa now and sad that there is not a closer Eddie v's to us. But to find out there is one coming soon! We have our reservations set for the king of Prussia location on November 2nd which happens to be my birthday! What better way to celebrate my birthday with you guys at Eddie v's! I cannot not wait and thank you Pittsburgh team for the amazing meal and experience!

Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster mashed potatoes

S_eYEtNQmWQa8G8IWin2SQ.text: I ordered wine and an appetizer. The crab cake came out lukewarm and when on my last bite the wine arrived.  I was very disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

bp6WfR6hx_XM1zYZEGDBUw.text: Truly an exquisite meal. A very fancy establishment as you would imagine. Extensive wine list to choose from. Great seafood selection. I tried swordfish steak for the first time it was very good, topped with avocado crab and chili. The fried oyster appetizer was my favorite I could have devoured so many of those. And the bananas foster desert is quite the delicious experience. Great spot for a classy date night!

Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Swordfish steak

09Icq0xms-j4kse311zxMg.text: Fantastic place.  Great food, drinks, and setting.  Had the filet and it was cooked perfectly.  Would absolutely recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Banshee wine was delicious

5S8SoXVbJFeT0fMwhFpokQ.text: Service was great at times, also poor at times...very inconsistent through out dinner.  Restaurant has a great atmosphere.  Bar area was very nice and a large drink selection.  The one thing that bothered us all is the gap between appetizers/salads and the main entree...way too long (30+ minutes).  As for the food...Lobster bisque was very good.  Sea Bass in light soy sauce with ginger and spinach was very good.  Others in our group had the scallops and all said they were not seared off enough...broccolini was just OK was kind of bland, brussel sprouts were too hard and not cooked enough, but the lobster mashed potatoes were excellent.  All in all somewhat disappointed considering the cost...they need to up there game if they want to charge those prices.  Lastly, waited 20 minutes for car at valet.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sea Bass in light soy sauce with ginger and spinach.

ZY2Efb64MoScELwkFpJR9Q.text: Had a nice vibe as soon as I walked in.  Tastefully decorated.  Friendly and attentive staff.  Our waiter reminded us of Franc from the movie "The Wedding Planner".  A little over the top he gave us a chuckle but was very helpful with recommendations.    My only complaint is the live jazz music was entirely too loud.  Needs to be toned down a bit more like background music it's a nice touch but I'm not there for a concert.  Could not have a conversation in the bar.  If you want to have a nice meal & conversation I recommend making reservations on the dining room side.  I'm sure you would still hear the music but be able to hear each other as well.  I don't enjoy shouting and saying "what?"every other word.  Food was very good but the only thing I can say really stood out was my drink.  I think it was called "Hope Diamond".  On menu under "24 Carat" drink. Delicious & highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. I think this was called &#34;Hope Diamond&#34;. Delicious!!! I could have kept going but stopped at 2.
